p: Further we assessed the correlation of expression levels of DARPP-32 and CaN in PFC and NAc (Fig. 3). Positive correlations were observed between the expression levels of DARPP-32 and CaN of controls in PFC (r = 0.585, p = 0.004) (Fig. 3a), patients with schizophrenia in PFC (r = 0.645, p = 0.002) (Fig. 3a) and NAc (r = 0.550, p = 0.010) (Fig. 3c). The ratio of these two proteins in each sample were compared between the diagnostic groups (Fig. 3b,d). In PFC, the ratio of DARPP-32/CaN in each sample were significantly low in schizophrenia patients compared to controls (t [29.72] = 4.45, p = 1.12e-4) (Fig. 3b), but no changes were observed in NAc (t [33.71] = −0.185, p = 0.854) (Fig. 3d).
